kerberosConfigContents.description: The contents of the Kerberos configuration file conforming to the specification. If you do not want the default KDC and realm values from this configuration file to be overridden, then do not set values for the kerberosRealm and kerberosKDC properties. It contains the Kerberos configuration information, including the Kerberos realm, locations of KDCs, defaults for the current realm and for Kerberos applications, and the host names, Kerberos realms mappings and encryption algorithms. The full specification details of the Kerberos configuration file can be found in https://linux.die.net/man/5/krb5.conf.

kerberosConfigFileName.description: The name of the Kerberos configuration file to be stored and maintained in API Gateway.

kerberosKDC.description: The host name of the machine on which the Key Distribution Center (KDC) resides. If kerberosKDC is set, it overrrides the default KDC specified in the provided configuration file.

kerberosRealm.description: The domain name of the Kerberos server. If kerberosRealm is set, it overrides the realm specified in the provided configuration file.

useSubjectCreds.description: Indicates whether the Kerberos v5 Generic Security Services (GSS) mechanism should be used to obtain credentials from an existing subject.

bitarray.description: Comma separated list of bits (1/0) indicating whether the particular key alias has been successfully configured in API Gateway or not. For each key alias, 1 indicates that the key alias was loaded successfully and 0 indicates that the key alias was not loaded/configured.

fileContent.description: The contents of the keystore file.

isLoaded.description: Indicates whether the keystore is loaded or not. A keystore may not be loaded if there are errors while reading the keystore file or its key aliases.

isWarning.description: Indicates whether a warning is thrown by the API Gateway while persisting the keystore.

keyStoreName.description: The name of the keystore. It cannot contain spaces or special characters. The name of the key store must be unique across all the keystores created in API Gateway.

keyStorePassword.description: The keystore password that is defined at the time of keystore creation using a keystore utility.

keyStoreType.description: The certificate file format of the keystore.

message.description: The error or warning or success message from persisting the keystore in API Gateway. If there are failures in loading a keystore or a key alias, then the reasons for the failures are indicated by this message.

nullPKpasswds.description: Comma separated list of boolean values (false/true) indicating whether the particular alias has a password or not in the same order as the aliases specified in pkAliasesList. For each key alias, true indicates that the key alias does not have a password and false indicates that it does have a password.

pkAliasesList.description: Comma separated list of alias names in the uploaded keystore file.

pkPasswordsList.description: Comma separated list of passwords in the same order as the aliases specified in pkAliasesList. If a particular key alias does not have a password, it is denoted by space.

uploadFileName.description: The name of the keystore file that will be used to save the keystore internally in API Gateway.

KeystoreTruststore.description: This defines the keystore and truststore requred for the API Gateway.

cacheSize.description: The maximum number of LDAP users Integration Server can keep in memory in the user cache. The default is 10.

cacheTTL.description: The number of minutes an LDAP user's credentials (userid and password) can remain in the credential cache before being purged. The default is 60 minutes.

ldapDirectoryList.description: List of LDAP directories. This field is applicable when LDAP provider is chosen.

provider.description: Choose the authentication provider. Possible values are 'local' and 'LDAP'

Distinguished Name (DN) method.description: Specifies the DN method used for building the DN. Possible values are 'true' and 'false'.Select 'true' if the DN should be synthesized from the configured prefix and suffix values (Synthesize DN Method). These values are prefixed and suffixed to the username to build the DN. Select 'false' if the DN should be queried from a specified root directory (Query DN Method). The Synthesize DN method can be faster than the Query DN method because it does not perform a query against the LDAP directory. However, if your LDAP system does not contain all users in a single flat structure, use the Query DN method instead.

dnPrefix.description: A string that specifies the beginning of a DN you want to pass to the LDAP server. This field is applicable when 'useaf' is configured as 'true'. i.e, Synthesize DN Method is chosen.For example, if the prefix is 'cn=' and the suffix is ',ou=Users' and a user logs in specifying 'bob', API Gateway builds the DN 'cn=bob,ou=Users' and sends it to the LDAP server for authentication.

dnSuffix.description: A string that specifies the end of a DN you want to pass to the LDAP server. This field is applicable when 'useaf' is configured as 'true'. i.e, Synthesize DN Method is chosen.For example, if the prefix is 'cn=' and the suffix is ',ou=Users' and a user logs in specifying 'bob', API Gateway builds the DN 'cn=bob,ou=Users' and sends it to the LDAP server for authentication.

group.description: An API Gateway group with which the user is associated. The user is allowed to access services that members of this API Gateway group can access. This access is controlled by the teams with which the group is associated. If you also specify a value in the 'memberAttribute' field, the user has the same access as members of the API Gateway group and members of LDAP groups that have been mapped to an API Gateway team.

groupIdProperty.description: A property that identifies an LDAP group, such as CN. This field is required.

groupRootDN.description: The full distinguished name. For example, if you specify 'ou=groups,webMethods,dc=com', API Gateway will issue a query that will display all the LDAP groups. This field is required.

index.description: Index of the current LDAP directory. Priority of the LDAP directory among other directories is calculated using the index. The starting value of index for the LDAP directory with first priority is 0 and is incremented by 1 for subsequent LDAP directories.

memberAttribute.description: The name of the attribute in a group's directory entry that identifies each member of the group. This value is usually 'member' or 'uniqueMember', but can vary depending on the schema of the LDAP directory. API Gateway uses this information during team checking to see if the user attempting to log in belongs to an LDAP group that has been mapped to a team. If no value is specified here, API Gateway does not check for membership in an LDAP group. As a result, the user's access is controlled by the API Gateway group specified in the 'group' field.

password.description: The password the API Gateway should supply to connect to the LDAP server, that is, the Principal's password.

poolMax.description: The maximum number of connections allowed in the pool that API Gateway maintains for connecting to the LDAP server. When API Gateway starts, the connection pool initially contains a minimum number of connections, which are specified in the Minimum Connection Pool field. API Gateway adds connections to the pool as needed until it reaches the maximum allowed. The default is 10.

poolMin.description: The minimum number of connections allowed in the pool that API Gateway maintains for connecting to the LDAP server. When API Gateway starts, the connection pool initially contains this minimum number of connections. API Gateway adds connections to the pool as needed until it reaches the maximum allowed, which is specified in the Maximum Connection Pool field. The default is 0.

principal.description: The user ID the Integration Server should supply to connect to the LDAP server, for example, o=webm.com or dc=webm,dc=com.  This user should not be the Administrator account, but a user that has permission to query groups and group membership. If your LDAP server allows anonymous access, leave this field blank.

timeout.description: The number of seconds the API Gateway will wait while trying to connect to the LDAP server. After this time has passed, the API Gateway will try the next configured LDAP server on the list. The default is 5 seconds.

uidProp.description: A property that identifies an LDAP userid, such as 'cn' or 'uid'.

url.description: The complete URL of the LDAP server. The URL has the format protocol://hostname:portnumber. Possible values of 'protocol' is 'ldap' for standard connections or 'ldaps' for secure connections. For example, ldaps://ldaphost1:700

userEmailAttribute.description: A property that identifies an LDAP user Email Address, such as 'mail' or 'email'.

userRootDn.description: Enter the full distinguished name. For example, configure this value as 'ou=users,dc=webMethods,dc=com', API Gateway will issue a query that starts searching in the root directory ou=users for a common name that matches the name the user logged in with.

httpUrls.description: HTTP URLs to be exposed for API invocation.

httpsUrls.description: HTTPS URLs to be exposed for API invocation.

websocketUrls.description: WebSocket URL to be exposed for Websocket APIs invocation.

LoadBalancer.description: This defines the Load Balancer URLs configuration in the API Gateway.

apigatewayLogger.description: The log setting of APIGateway server.Possible values are off,trace,debug,info,warn,error and fatal

elasticSearchLogger.description: The log setting of Internal Data Store.Possible values are off,info,debug,warn,error and fatal

enableLogAggregation.description: Enabling log aggregation will collect logs from the different components and store in Internal Data Store or external Elasticsearch.The value can be true or false.

enableSecurityLogger.description: The log setting to enable APIGateway security logs.Possible values are true and false.

enableSessionLogger.description: The log setting enable APIGateway session logs.Possible values are off,trace,debug,info,warn,error and fatal

hostName.description: Hostname of external elastic search used to send the logs.

indexName.description: Indexname of external elastic search to store the accumulated logs.

kibanaLogger.description: The log setting of APIGateway dashboard.Possible values are silent,quiet and verbose

logDestination.description: Specifies where to store the accumulated logs from different stores. Value can be EXTERNAL_ES or INTERNAL

password.description: Password that is used to communicate the external elastic search.

port.description: Port to communicate the external elastic search.

protocol.description: Protocol to communicate the external elastic search.

sagOsgiLogger.description: The log setting of OSGI platform.Possible values are true and false.

userName.description: Username to communicate the external elastic search.

LogConfiguration.description: This contains log settings of various components used by APIGateway.

expireInterval.description: This interval(in days) specifies the time after which the master password would expire

MasterPasswordExpiryInterval.description: The expiration interval is a recommended time between master password changes.The default expiration interval for a master password is 90 days.After the expiration date,API Gateway will continue to operate using the existing password indefinitely.

message.description: The response message from the server when the master password expiry interval is updated

result.description: This is the updated master password expiry interval(in days)

MasterPasswordExpiryIntervalResponse.description: The schema of the response from the server when the expiry interval is updated

daysTilExpire.description: The remaining number of days for the master password expiration

expireDate.description: The expiry date of the master password.The format for this field would be YYYY-MM-DD HH:mm:ssZ

expireInterval.description: The interval(in days) after which the master password would expire

expireMessage.description: The message which will be returned once the master password is expired

lastChangeDate.description: The latest date when the master password was updated.The format for this field would be YYYY-MM-DD HH:mm:ssZ

statusMessage.description: The current status of the master password

MasterPasswordProperties.description: Describes the master password configuration properties in API Gateway

handleCount.description: The number of passwords that are updated during master password reset

message.description: The response message from the server when the master password is reset

MasterPasswordResetResponse.description: Describes the response when the master password is reset

newPassword.description: This is the base64 encoded value of the new master password

oldPassword.description: This is the base64 encoded value of the old master password

MasterPasswordUpdate.description: Describes the properties required for updating the master password

message.description: The response message from the server when the master password is updated

action.description: The type of migration action to be performed

indicesType.description: The type of indices to be reindexed for reindex action

properties.description: Migration properties for reindex action. Default values are taken from migration.properties file. Any value passed in here would overwrite the default value.

MigrationConfig.description: This model contains details about migration inputs in API Gateway

NotificationCriteria.description: This defines the notification criteria required for the transaction based license to generate notifications.

proxyServerList.description: Contains a map of the available outbound proxy server aliases in API Gateway with the key denoting the alias name and the value representing the corresponding outbound proxy server alias configuration.

entityId.description: The proxy server alias used to identify the entity in API Gateway.

ftpType.description: The type of the FTP proxy server. Applicable only if protocol value is FTP. Indicated by a number in the range 0 to 7. 0 - No proxy, 1 - ftp_user@ftp_host no proxy auth, 2 - ftp_user@ftp_host proxy auth, 3 - site command, 4 - open command, 5 - ftp_user@proxy_user@ftp_host, 6 - proxy_user@ftp_host, 7 - ftp_user@ftp_host proxy_user

host.description: The host name or IP address of the proxy server.

isDefault.description: Indicates whether this proxy server alias is the default for the corresponding protocol. There can be only one default proxy server alias for a given protocol. Y denotes Yes and N denotes No.

password.description: The password required to authenticate if authentication is enabled for the proxy server.

passwordHandle.description: The password handle which is used to store the password (if specified) in a secure manner in API Gateway.

port.description: The port number of the proxy server.

protocol.description: The protocol for which the proxy server is created.

proxyAlias.description: The outbound proxy server alias name. It must be unique across all outbound proxy server aliases defined in API Gateway. Once a proxy server alias is defined with a given name, it cannot be modified further.

socksVersion.description: The SOCKS version of the proxy server. Applicable only if protocol value is SOCKS. A value of 4 indicates SOCKS protocol version 4 and a value of 5 indicates SOCKS protocol version 5. SOCKS protocol version 4 does not support authentication and hence username/password cannot be specified if socksVersion = 4.

status.description: Indicates whether the particular proxy server alias is enabled or disabled.

username.description: The user name required to authenticate against if authentication is enabled for the proxy server.

applicableUsers.description: List of users to whom the expiration interval setting is applicable. The users are separated by semicolon(;). For example, if you want to add user1 and user2 to the list, specify as 'user1;user2'

emailIds.description: List of email addresses to which API Gateway sends an email notification informing that the user password is about to expire or has already expired. The email addresses are separated by a new line character (\n). For example, 'u1@abc.com\nu2@abc.com'

expirationInterval.description: Number of days after which a password will expire, if not changed. The value should be a non-zero integer. Default value is 90.

expiryEmailBefore.description: Specifies the number of days prior to password expiry that API Gateway should start sending the reminder emails for password reset. The emails are sent daily until the user either updates the password or changes the expiration interval. Set the value to 0 to prevent API Gateway from sending the reminder emails for soon to expire passwords. Default value is 3.

isEnabled.description: Specifies whether to enable the password expiry settings. Possible values are 'true' (enabled) and 'false' (disabled). Default value is 'false'

enablePasswordChange.description: Specifies whether users are allowed to change their passwords. These users must have developer privileges. Possible values are 'true' and 'false'. Default value is 'true'

historyLength.description: Maximum number of previously set passwords that API Gateway saves for a user (excluding the current password). You cannot choose a password that matches any of the stored passwords. Maximum value allowed for this field is 12. Default value is 0.

maxIdenticalCharsInARow.description:
Maximum number of identical characters
in a row a password can contain. Default value is 3

maxLength.description: Maximum number of characters (alphabetic characters, digits, and special characters combined) the password can contain. Default value is 64. Maximum value allowed for this field is 128

minDigits.description: Minimum number of digits the password must contain. Default value is 0

minLength.description: Minimum number of characters (alphabetic characters, digits, and special characters combined) the password must contain.Default value is 8

minLowerChars.description: Minimum number of lowercase alphabetic characters the password must contain. Default value is 0

minSpecialChars.description: Minimum number of special characters, such as asterisk (*), period (.), and question mark (?) the password must contain. Default value is 0

minUpperChars.description: Minimum number of uppercase alphabetic characters the password must contain. Default value is 0

mode.description: Specifies whether Administrator users are allowed to choose passwords that are not impacted by the password restriction settings. Possible values are 'strict' and 'lax'. Default value is 'lax'. For Administrator users, when this property is set to 'strict', API Gateway enforces the password restrictions. When set to 'lax', the password restrictions are not enforced. For non-administrators the restrictions are always enforced.

status.description: Staus of the API Portal community.

PortalCommunities.description: This defines the API Portal communities configuration in the API Gateway.

gatewayPassword.description: API Gateway password for provided username used by API Portal to access API Gateway.

gatewayURL.description: Integration Server URL of the API Gateway.

gatewayUsername.description: API Gateway administrative privileged username used by API Portal to access API Gateway.

id.description: API Portal configuration object ID in API Gateway.

refId.description: Specifies API Gateway reference ID in API Portal. This is used to identify the API Gateway in API Portal.

stageName.description: Specifies the current stage name of the Gateway

PortalGateway.description: This defines the Portal Gateway configuration in the API Gateway.

provider.description: The API Portal destination configuration name

PortalGatewayCommunitiesData.description: This defines the API Portal provider and communities information.

portalCommunities.description: List of API Portal communities to which APIs should be published.

PortalGatewayData.description: This defines the API Portal Gateway data in the API Gateway.

entityId.description: proxyBypass constance Fixed unique identifier value is proxyBypass

proxyBypassAddresses.description:
The host name or IP address of the server. In the Addresses field, type the fully qualified host and domain name of each server to which you want the Integration Server to issue requests directly. Type the host name and the domain name exactly as they appear in the URLs the server uses. To enter multiple names, separate each with commas.
You can use the asterisk (*) to identify several servers with similar names. The asterisk matches any number of characters. For example, if you want to bypass requests made to localhost, www.yahoo.com, home.microsoft.com, and all hosts whose names begin with NYC, you would type:
localhost,www.yahoo.com,home.microsoft.com, NYC*.*

block.description: Specifies the type of blocking for quiesce mode in API Gateway

enable.description: Specifies whether to enable or disable quiesce mode for API Gateway

failureReason.description: Specifies the failure reason of the last quiesce mode operation if the status is a failure

flush.description: Specifies the types of data that need to be flushed when quiesce mode for all is enabled in API Gateway

status.description: Specifies the current status of the last quiesce mode operation. A null value means that the quiesce mode action is still in progress and the status is not yet known

QuiesceMode.description: This contains quiesce mode settings for APIGateway.

attributeContexts.description: Context(s) of the attribute used in rule expression

id.description: A unique ID for the rule

ruleExpressions.description: Rule condition is defined using ruleExpressions

ruleLogicalOperator.description: Logical operator (AND / OR) that should be used to evaluate Rule expression

hostname.description: Flag to enable save of the life cycle events.

port.description: The SNMP trap receiver port that is listening for SNMP requests and packets.

sendErrorEvent.description: Flag to enable publish of the error events. Occurs each time an API invocation results in an error.

sendLifecycleEvent.description: Flag to enable publish of the life cycle events. Occurs each time API Gateway is started or shut down.

sendPolicyViolationEvent.description: Flag to enable publish of the policy violations events. Occurs each time an API invocation violates the policy enforcement that was set for the API.

snmpTargetType.description: Specifies target type of the SNMP server.

transport.description: The protocol used by SNMP to send traps. The available options are: TCP and UDP. By default, TCP is selected.

useAuthorization.description: Specifies whether an authorization key is required.

usePrivacy.description: Specifies whether a privacy (encryption) key is required.

username.description: If User is selected as the SNMP target type, then the Username field specifies the SNMPv3 user name to use when connecting to the receiver.

SNMPDestination.description: This defines the configurations required for the SNMP destination.

idpFilename.description: Specifies the file name of identity provider metadata.

idpMetadataContent.description: Specifies base64 encoded file content of identity provider metadata.

idpUrl.description: Specifies the identity provider metadata URL.

keystoreAlias.description: Specifies the keystore alias to be used to generate service provider metadata.

saml_assertion_signed.description: Specifies whether SAML assertion is to be signed from the identity provider.

saml_authreq_signed.description: Specifies whether auth request should signed by the service provider.

saml_defaultkey_alias.description: Specifies the key alias to be used for signing and encryption.

saml_enabled.description: Specifies whether SSO should be enabled or not.

saml_encrypkey_alias.description: Specifies the key alias to be used for encryption.

saml_redirect.description: Specifies the service provider SSO URL.

saml_signkey_alias.description: Specifies the key alias to be used for signing.

saml_sp_id.description: Specifies the service provider entity ID.

useSSOLoginByDefault.description: Specifies whether SSO login page is redirected by default.

extendedKeys.description: A map containing the API Gateway Extended Settings key-value pair.

wattKeys.description: A map containing the Integration Server Watt properties key-value pair.

bounce.description: Specifies whether to restart API Gateway server after shutdown. A value of true would restart the server. Default value is false.

option.description: Specifies whether to shutdown API Gateway server immediately or after all client sessions are ended. A value of 'force' would shutdown the server immediately and 'drain' would wait for a maximum period of time for all the client sessions to end before shutdown.

quiesce.description: A value of true would first flush the API Gateway in memory data like performance metrics, license metrics and subscription quota to datastore before shutdown of the server. Next, when API Gateway is restarted either manually or using bounce parameter, the Integration server will be started in Quiesce mode. Note: In a cluster, the flushing of in memory data would happen only on one of the nodes and hence on other nodes the API call would return immediately by eliminating the flush time. The default value is false.

timeout.description: Specifies the maximum wait time in minutes before API Gateway server is shutdown when option drain is specified.

Shutdown.description: This contains parameters for APIGateway shutdown resource.

teamsAssigned.description: List of teams to be assigned, if conditions of rule expression is met

certificateAliases.description: The list of aliases that are available within the truststore.

fileContent.description: The contents of the truststore file.

id.description: The unique identifier for the truststore.

isLoaded.description: Indicates whether the truststore is loaded or not. A truststore may not be loaded if there are errors while reading the truststore file.

isWarning.description: Indicates whether there is a warning message from the API Gateway while the truststore was created/modified.

keyStoreLocation.description: The location where the truststore is saved in API Gateway.

keyStoreName.description: The name of the truststore. It cannot contain spaces or special characters.

keyStorePassword.description: The truststore password that is defined at the time of truststore creation using a keystore utility.

keyStoreType.description: The certificate file format of the truststore.

message.description: The warning message if any. Applies only if isWarning = true

uploadFileName.description: The name of the truststore file that will be used to save the truststore internally in API Gateway.

TrustStore.description: Model containing the properties of a truststore in API Gateway

alias.description: The unique alias name given for the URL aliases. When invoked with this alias, the path will be substituted.

apiId.description: API linked to this URL alias; applicable only if this URL alias is specific to an API

association.description: Indicates how the URL Alias is created. This value is always 1.

package.description: The package to which the URL Alias is associated. Any URL Alias created through the API should always be associated with the WmAPIGateway package.

portList.description: An array of port specific mappings for paths. Each mapping in this array must be specified as port_number#url_path. Either urlPath or portList must be specified.

urlPath.description: The default path which must be substituted for the URL alias. If port specific mappings are provided, then this default path is considered if none of the ports are matched with the port of the incoming request. Either urlPath or portList must be specified.

URLAliasSettings.description: This model contains URL Aliases details

urlAliases.description: Contains the list of available URL aliases or a single URL alias object.

emailAddresses.description: Specifies the attribute from SAML assertion to be mapped with APIGateway user profile's email address.

firstName.description: Specifies the attribute from SAML assertion to be mapped with APIGateway user profile's first name.

lastName.description: Specifies the attribute from SAML assertion to be mapped with APIGateway user profile's last name.

active.description: Specifies whether this webhook is active or not. Default value is false.

events.description: The list of interested events this webhook is subscribed for

id.description: A unique ID for the webhook

Webhook.description: This model contains details about a webhook in API Gateway

headers.description: The HTTP headers to be sent in the request when the event is occurred

password.description: The password required to authenticate if authentication is enabled for the webhook endpoint.

truststoreAlias.description: Specify the truststore that needs to be used by API Gateway while sending the request to the webhook endpoint.

url.description: The URL to which API Gateway sends the payload when the event is occurred

username.description: The user name required to authenticate against if authentication is enabled for the webhook endpoint.

WebhookConfig.description: This model contains webhook configuration details like url, headers, etc in API Gateway

WebserviceEndpointAliasId.description: A unique ID for the WebserviceEndpointAlias

aliasType.description: The property specifies the aliasType, Either it should be Provider or Consumer

keyAlias.description: this property specifies the keyalias name

keyStoreAlias.description: this property specifies the keystorealias name

timestampMaximumSkew.description: this property specifies the timestampMaximumSkew value

timestampTimeToLive.description: this property specifies the timestampTimeToLive value

transportType.description: this defines the transport type. The supported transport type is JMS

trustStoreAlias.description: this property specifies the trustStoreAlias name

privateIPs.description: List of private whitelisted IPs to be considered while API is created / updated by importing a url and import an archive

WhiteListedIPs.description: This defines the whitelisting of private IPs configured in the API Gateway.
